wikipedia_page.main:
James Brabazon Grimston, 5th Earl of Verulam (11 October 1910 – 13 October 1960) was a British peer and businessman.Verulam was the eldest son of James Grimston, 4th Earl of Verulam, and Lady Violet Brabazon, younger daughter of the  12th Earl of Meath. He was educated at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford. His first job was in Austria after which he was managing director of Enfield Zinc Products. In 1949 he became chairman of Enfield Rolling Mills.He was mayor of St Albans in 1956; and president of the Cremation Society from  1955 to 1958. He was also a director of the District Bank and sat on various committees concerned with health, welfare and disability.
He was succeeded in titles by his younger brother, John Grimston.

response: *James Grimston, 5th Earl of Verulam (1910–1960), British peer and businessman
